result.reason: VncSharpCore's ToAscii keyboard handling consumes dead key state from the Windows keyboard buffer, breaking compose sequences (accent + letter); the existing VncLockKeyFilter can be extended to intercept WM_DEADCHAR and compose the final character before sending the correct X11 keysym
result.approach: Extend VncLockKeyFilter to intercept WM_DEADCHAR (0x0103) messages, store the dead key state, then on the subsequent WM_CHAR compose the final accented character and send the correct Unicode-to-X11-keysym via WriteKeyboardEvent, suppressing VncSharpCore's broken ToAscii path
